Issues.Title: I mistakenly took 0 as the divisor in computed, Caused Vue devtool to crash
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[sfc.vuejs.org/](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
```
computed:{
   val1(){
      return 10/0
   }
}
```

### What is expected?
Expected to disable compilation

### What is actually happening?
Cause devtool to crash, It's not that easy to troubleshoot

Issues.Title: jsx 里面的props属性
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[https://sfc.vuejs.org/#](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
**当父组件使用temlpate模板时候**
`<template>
   <ecy-cascader
    :props="props"></ecy-cascader>
</template>`

**子组件ecyCascader使用$attrs**

`<template>
  <el-cascader
    v-bind="$attrs">
  </el-cascader>
</template>`
可以将**props**传递到el-cascader组件里面
**但是父组件使用jsx的时候**
`<EcyCascader
          options={this.options}
          props={props}
        ></EcyCascader>`
**$attrs** 无法将**props**传递到el-cascader组件里面，但是可以通过设置attrs={props}进行传递

### What is expected?
希望template和写jsx时候保持一致

### What is actually happening?
需要用不同的属性值props和attrs去传递

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "jsx 里面的props属性" (#12535)

In MyBooleanStringSelect component

### What is actually happening?
Value is True

---
MyBooleanStringSelect  and MyStringBooleanSelect have different behavior for prop value equals to ''

Issues.Title: Hydration mismatch at {{ "" }} inside v-for
Issues.Body: ### Version 2.6.14 ### Reproduction link [codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/zealous-yonath-h71cyk?file=/src/App.vue) ### Steps to reproduce - nuxt: v2.15.18 - node: v16.14.0 ```html {{ "" }}Test ``` Important for me was it in this usecase ```html {{ index > 0 ? ", " : "" }}{{obj.text}} ``` I don't know that much about vue without nuxt, so I can't say how to reproduce sss, just came here by this comment https://github.com/nuxt/nuxt.js/issues/10390#issuecomment-1100752569 I used `nuxt dev` with `target: 'static'` in nuxt.config. ### What is expected? normal hydration ### What is actually happening? I get a hydration mismatch because nuxt on ssr somehow thinks there is a node with empty content and undefined type and on clientside there correctly no node. --- ### Workaround use instead: ```html {{ "" }}Test ``` resp. ```html , Test ``` First posted issue here: https://github.com/nuxt/nuxt.js/issues/10390
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hydration mismatch at {{ "" }} inside v-for" (#12523)

Issues.Title: Repeated watch triggers 重复的watch触发行为
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/patient-voice-2fst7s?file=/src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
Please open the console and enter a value. At this time, the a property has not changed, but it is triggered once, but c does not, and a is not triggered when the second character is entered.
我同时watch了三个属性 a b c  但是当我第一次改变b时  a也被触发了,但是c并没有 ( 我如果事先定义好b就没问题了,但是我的属性是动态的,无法初始定义)


### What is expected?
Trigger only its own listeners  (只触发自己的监听器)

### What is actually happening?
Repeated watch triggers  (a不该被触发)

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Repeated watch triggers 重复的watch触发行为" (#12522)

Issues.Title: Optimize the use and judgment of NODE_ENV
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Uniform processing and judgment of Node env

### What does the proposed API look like?
```js
export const isProduction = process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production';
export const isNotProduction = !isProduction;

```

Extends vue-server-renderer to handle async initializations. Read more in https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/12511
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix Module Federation & Vue 2 SSR: support async initialization #12511" (#12512)

Issues.Title: Module Federation & Vue 2 SSR: support async initialization
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
In order for Module Federation to work correctly, it requires a bootstrap entry file that serves as an asynchronous boundary between the host and the remote code. This way *It will split out the initialization code of a larger chunk to avoid any additional round trips and improve performance in general*. (Read more in: [the issue in module-federation](https://github.com/module-federation/module-federation-examples/issues/375#issuecomment-707442224), [webpack documentation](https://webpack.js.org/concepts/module-federation/#troubleshooting) and [a blog post](https://dev.to/waldronmatt/tutorial-a-guide-to-module-federation-for-enterprise-n5#host)).

When we try this concept in Vue 2 (latest version, 2.6.14), during SSR, vue-server-renderer will complain as it expects the module export to be a function, regardless of whether it will run it in a new context or not (`runInNewContext`).

See below commit (over the vue-hackernews example project) where the issue is minimally reproduced: The server entry will simply export the function creating the app instance through an import, instead of exporting it directly: https://github.com/tameraydin/vue-hackernews-2.0/commit/074192d9da26f8d78c742acb4328468edb19806c

### What does the proposed API look like?
There would be no need to introduce any new API or a breaking change. We would like vue-server-renderer to support also such async initializations; in other words, to accept also `Promise` (e.g. `import`) type of exports which would then resolve to a function that it currently expects, so that the Module Federation & SSR can be fully achieved in Vue 2.

We have solved this in our local fork (through a small refactoring over [createBundleRunner](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/src/server/bundle-renderer/create-bundle-runner.js#L91)) with proper testing and are happy to open a pull-request - but of course, we would like get your feedback first.

_**PS**. I created a draft PR in case it provides a better context._

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Module Federation & Vue 2 SSR: support async initialization" (#12511)

Issues.Title: URL with line breaks are not properly managed
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-router-issue-with-history-mode-and-multiline-url-n4wd79)







### Steps to reproduce
From Codesandbox reproduction link:
1. Open Codesandbox
2. Click on "Click me"
3. The browser opens `example.org`

Locally:
1. Create a blank Vue app with vue-router
2. Add a link as follow: <router-link :to="url">Click me</router-link>
3. Specify a url with a line break such as :
```js
/
/example.com
```
4. Click the link, your browser will open `/example.com`

### What is expected?
It should trigger an error. Whether not a valid URL or not the same origin or redirect to `/`.
Or it should redirects to `//example.com` (removing line breaks)

### What is actually happening?
The browser opens `http://example.com`

---
The bug was reported to us by a bug hunter. 

One of our URL `https://dashboard.mailmeteor.com/login?redirect=%2F` was affected by the bug. If you share a URL to Mailmeteor having a line break in it, such as `https://dashboard.mailmeteor.com/login?redirect=%2F%0D%0A%2Fexample.com`, our application was redirecting to the distant domain. This has been fixed on our application by preventing redirection to URLs with multiple lines.

While looking at the source of this issue, turns out that vue-router codebase defaults to `window.location.replace` in case the `history.replaceState` methods triggers an error. See here: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/677f3c1f714fb61cc495345e535409b1cbb90429/src/util/push-state.js#L40

And `window.location.replace(url)` has a "bug" that when you provide a url with a line break, it redirects to the last line:

```
var url = `/
/example.org`
window.location.replace(url) // opens "example.org"
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "URL with line breaks are not properly managed" (#3743)

Issues.Title: `$route.query = { xxx: undefined }` affects `router-link-exact-active`
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
https://codepen.io/sws797/pen/NWyraYK?editors=1111







### Steps to reproduce
click `<router-link to="/register">`  
-> browser's address bar: `http://localhost:8080/#/register`  
-> `<router-link to="/register">Register</router-link>` has `router-link-exact-active` and `router-link-active`  

click `<router-link :to="{ name: 'Register' }">`  
-> browser's address bar: `http://localhost:8080/#/register`  
-> `<router-link to="/register">Register</router-link>` has `router-link-exact-active` and `router-link-active`  

click `<router-link :to="{ name: 'Register', query = {} }">`  
-> browser's address bar: `http://localhost:8080/#/register`  
-> `<router-link to="/register">Register</router-link>` has `router-link-exact-active` and `router-link-active`  

BUT click  `<router-link :to="{ name: 'Register', query = { redirect: undefined } }">`  
-> browser's address bar: `http://localhost:8080/#/register`  
-> BUT `<router-link to="/register">Register</router-link>` only has `router-link-active`  

### What is expected?
The same browser's address bar get same router-link-exact-active

### What is actually happening?
Although the address bar is `/register`, different access methods have different effects

---
Do you have a more detailed description of `router-link-exact-active`? [https://v3.router.vuejs.org/zh/api/#exact-active-class](https://v3.router.vuejs.org/zh/api/#exact-active-class) has few descriptions

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`$route.query = { xxx: undefined }` affects `router-link-exact-active`" (#3748)

Issues.Title: <keep-alive>组件，第1次回退到keepAlive页面时，页面没有缓存，要第2次回退才会缓存？
Issues.Body:
代码如下：
<keep-alive>
        <router-view v-if="$route.meta.keepAlive" :key="$route.fullPath"></router-view>
</keep-alive>
<router-view v-if="!$route.meta.keepAlive" :key="$route.fullPath"></router-view>

假定有2个页面，一个是列表页面，另外一个是详情页面，其中的列表页面需要缓存，在路由里加上了meta:keepAlive，详情页面不需要缓存。

问题：
打开列表页面，然后再进入详情页面，然后再退回上一页(即列表页面)，这时候列表页面没有缓存。然后再从列表页面，进入到详情页面，然后再退回上一页，这时候列表页面就缓存了。

为什么第一次回退时没有缓存，而只有在第2次到第N次，才会有缓存？
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "<keep-alive>组件，第1次回退到keepAlive页面时，页面没有缓存，要第2次回退才会缓存？" (#3749)

Issues.Title: Select component by routes query
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
At the moment, it is not possible to show a different component by the query.

It should be possible to use the `?` as part of the route instead of just to make parts optional, possibly by escaping it.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```
{
  path: "/app/user\?userId=:userId",
  name: "user",
  component: UserView,
},
{
  path: "/app/user\?action=delete&userId=:userId",
  name: "user",
  component: DeleteUserView,
},
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Add ability to goBackTo (pathname)
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Our app has pages that require a bluetooth connection, we need the ability to send the user back to a neutral page if they lose connection/disconnect.

 Something like router.goBackTo(pathname) would solve this problem.

### What does the proposed API look like?
new goBackTo method that finds the delta to invoke router.go with for navigating back

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add ability to goBackTo (pathname) " (#3730)

Issues.Title: Uncaught (in promise) Error: Navigation cancelled from "/login" to "/" with a new navigation.
Issues.Body: My project has a role permission verification, so there are two routes configuration named `staticRoutes` and `dynamicRoutes` in local. I add a router hook: `beforeEach` in `router/index.js` When I click login button in login page, it should jump to '/', but it failed with error: 'Uncaught (in promise) Error: Navigation cancelled from "/login" to "/" with a new navigation.'
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Uncaught (in promise) Error: Navigation cancelled from "/login" to "/" with a new navigation." (#3731)

Issues.Title: Export RouterLink and RouterView component
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?

https://github.com/vuejs/create-vue using local component registry in vue 3 template.
 
see https://github.com/vuejs/create-vue-templates/blob/284fcf591115e5cf39e4461e2fd4cd2c5ea009bb/typescript-router/src/App.vue#L2

```ts
import { RouterLink, RouterView } from 'vue-router'
```

We can import RouterLink and RouterView in vue-router v4

I think we should also export it in vue-router v3 . 

It will help typescript users and jsx users a lot. We can get better type information with this.

And also, we use lint rule https://eslint.vuejs.org/rules/no-undef-components.html

```js
{
    'vue/no-undef-components': [
        'error',
        {
            ignorePatterns: [
                /**
                 * Waiting for vue-router
                 */
                'RouterView',
                'RouterLink', 
            ],
        },
    ]
}
```

If vue-router v3 can export  RouterLink and RouterView, we can simplified configuration.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```ts
import { RouterLink, RouterView } from 'vue-router'

const { RouterLink, RouterView } = require('vue-router')
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Export RouterLink and RouterView component" (#3729)

Issues.Title: regexp is not applied when name is specified
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/fumifumitaro/bag-vue-router)







### Steps to reproduce
```
{
  path: "/user/:user_id(\\d+)",
  name: "User",
  component: "UserComponent"
}
```

I defined route like this.

```
router.push('/user/abc')
```

This successfully returns a 404 error.

```
router.push({
  name: 'User',
  params: {
    user_id: 'abc' // similarly when null
  }
})
```

regexp do not apply in this case, and UserComponent is displayed.



### What is expected?
regexp should be applied

### What is actually happening?
regexp is not applied when name is specified

Issues.Title: vux get states
Issues.Body:
I am a junior vuejs front-end developer.
I use vue3 and composition api (version:  "^3.2.33") using vueX state management (version: "^4.0.2").
As you know we should use the computed callback function to get data from vuex state, then return the data in the setup function to use it in the template.
The problem is that I need the value of the computed callback function to get data from vuex state BEFORE ITS FIRST RENDERING through setup return. The first time it returns the default value which is defined in the vueX ALTHOUGH  THERE IS A DISPATCH TO CHANGE ITS STATE value.
when there is a dispatch in the setup the value is the default value taken from the vuex, and the value is not updated before setup return.
Is there any solution to get the value of the computed callback function which returns a from vuex state before its first rendering in the setup? I need the value before returning from the setup, is there any solution?
by the way, I tried to get the value in the unMounted in the setup function and mounded outside of setUp but there was not any solution.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "vux get states " (#2165)

Issues.Title: package.json does not export ./package.json
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/nicksellen/vuex-package-json)







### Steps to reproduce
Steps are included in the README for the repo, here is a minimal version. I have node version v17.9.0 so it might be dependent on some recent changes there...

```
git clone https://github.com/nicksellen/vuex-package-json.git
cd vuex-package-json
yarn
npx quasar info
```

### What is expected?
It should show that vuex is installed, like this:

```
vuex - 4.0.2 -- state management for Vue.js
```

### What is actually happening?
It shows:

```
vuex - Not installed
```

When I add some debug output, the error underlying is:

```
Package subpath './package.json' is not defined by "exports" in /tmp/foo/quasar-project/node_modules/vuex/package.json
```

---
It's actually fixed in the #main branch of vuex 6 months ago in [this commit](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/commit/397e9fba45c8b4ec0c4a33d2578e34829bd348d7) , it's just not been released...  manually applying that change to `node_modules/vuex/package.json` resolves the issue locally.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "package.json does not export ./package.json" (#2160)

Issues.Title: Update Testing Actions Documentation to No Longer Reference `inject-loader`
Issues.Body:
Hi,

This PR removes references to `inject-loader` from the Testing Actions section.  `inject-loader` is no longer working/supported, based on this issue: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-cli/issues/947

I fell into the same trap (that others have expressed in that ticket) of trying to get my tests to work following the example code, but only to find out that the `inject-loader` example code no longer works.

I hope that by removing the example code that doesn't work, it can save other newbies like me some time.

I also added a Jest example in case that can be helpful to others.

Sorry if this PR is not the right format.  I tried to follow the contribution guidelines, but could not find a version 4 branch or a `dev` branch in the repo.

Please let me know if there's anything else I should modify.

Thanks for building such a great product and providing well-written documentation. 🙏
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update Testing Actions Documentation to No Longer Reference `inject-loader`" (#2155)

Issues.Title: Update documentation to mention maintenance/EOL/etc
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[https://vuex.vuejs.org/](https://vuex.vuejs.org/)







### Steps to reproduce
According to the Vue.js documentation, Vuex is no longer being worked on. As documented here, https://vuejs.org/guide/scaling-up/state-management.html#pinia, it says:

"With Pinia serving the same role in the ecosystem, Vuex is now in maintenance mode. It still works, but will no longer receive new features."

However, nothing on Vuex's main page (https://vuex.vuejs.org/) states this.

### What is expected?
I would add something with a highlight of some sort, close to the top of the homepage, that makes it clear Vuex is no longer being updated. 

### What is actually happening?
It doesn't say this.

---
This form requires a URL that links to a reproduction of the bug. However I'm reporting an issue with documentation. Perhaps this form should be updated to clearly state how someone reports a doc bug?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: docs: update jsfiddle link
Issues.Body:
## Why
Jsfiddle application in the getting started section of the version `3.x` of vuex is not working because generic links are used which point to latest versions: `vue@4` and `vuex@3`.

## What changes 
The new fiddle link simply changes the cdn links to point to `vue@3` and `vuex@2` instead.
Concretely, the links changed are:
- https://unpkg.com/vue -> https://unpkg.com/vue@2
- https://unpkg.com/vuex -> https://unpkg.com/vuex@3

## Result
The demo application works again. Check it out:
- Old jsfiddle : https://jsfiddle.net/n9jmu5v7/1269/
- New jsfiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/ywpudorb/
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: update jsfiddle link" (#2148)
